mcm.graphics
Class ImageShape

java.lang.Object
  mcm.graphics.Shape
      mcm.graphics.ImageShape

public class ImageShape
extends Shape

ImageShape objects wrap an ImageIcon.

Author:
Monika Mevenkamp

Constructor Detail

ImageShape

public ImageShape(java.lang.String imageFile,
                  Drawable c)
Constructs a new ImageShape object. This constructor has the same effect as ImageShape(imageFile, stage, CENTER).

Parameters:
imageFile - image file used to construct the image for this shape

ImageShape

public ImageShape(java.lang.String imageFile,
                  int hotSpotMode,
                  Drawable drawable)
Constructs a new ImageShape object. This constructor reads image information from the given file. If the constructor encounters a problem reading the image information it prints an error message and assumes a rectangular filled shape. The constructed shape object uses the given hotSpot mode.

Parameters:
imageFile - image file used to construct the image for this shape
hotSpotMode - the shape's hotSpotMode
drawable - a drawable that may be used as image observer when painting
See Also:
ImageIcon.paintIcon(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, int, int), Shape.setHotSpot(int)

ImageShape

public ImageShape(javax.swing.ImageIcon icon,
                  int hotSpotMode,
                  Drawable drawable)
Constructs a new ImageShape object from the given ImageIcon. The constructed shape object uses the given hotSpot mode.

Parameters:
icon - the imageIcon to be used by the new shape
hotSpotMode - the new shape's hotSpotMode
drawable - a drawable that may be used as image observer when painting
See Also:
Shape.setHotSpot(int), ImageIcon.paintIcon(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, int, int)

setSize

public void setSize(double width,
                    double height)
Scales the image to be width by height pixels. width and height are rounded to the nearest integer value.

Overrides:
setSize in class Shape
Parameters:
width - width of the scaled image; must be greater zero
height - height of the scaled image; must be greater zero
